pullrequest.title: Communication model based on graph cost

content.raw:
After a fresh install, I run `roslaunch subt_gazebo visibility.launch scenario:=tunnel_practice_1` and I get the following error:

```
Building LUT
100 %
corrupted size vs. prev_size
Aborted (core dumped)
[gazebo-2] process has died [pid 10066, exit code 134, cmd /opt/ros/melodic/lib/gazebo_ros/gzserver -e ode -s libVisibilityPlugin.so --verbose /home/nkoenig/subt_ws/install/share/subt_gazebo/worlds/tunnel_practice_1.world __name:=gazebo __log:=/home/nkoenig/.ros/log/1dc4cb0c-fd63-11e8-ad26-ac9e17b7716c/gazebo-2.log].
log file: /home/nkoenig/.ros/log/1dc4cb0c-fd63-11e8-ad26-ac9e17b7716c/gazebo-2*.log
```

I also deleted the `tunnel_practice_1.dat` file, ran the same launch file and the result was the same.
content.html:
After a fresh install, I run roslaunch subt_gazebo visibility.launch scenario:=tunnel_practice_1 and I get the following error:

Building LUT
100 %
corrupted size vs. prev_size
Aborted (core dumped)
[gazebo-2] process has died [pid 10066, exit code 134, cmd /opt/ros/melodic/lib/gazebo_ros/gzserver -e ode -s libVisibilityPlugin.so --verbose /home/nkoenig/subt_ws/install/share/subt_gazebo/worlds/tunnel_practice_1.world __name:=gazebo __log:=/home/nkoenig/.ros/log/1dc4cb0c-fd63-11e8-ad26-ac9e17b7716c/gazebo-2.log].
log file: /home/nkoenig/.ros/log/1dc4cb0c-fd63-11e8-ad26-ac9e17b7716c/gazebo-2*.log

I also deleted the tunnel_practice_1.dat file, ran the same launch file and the result was the same.

pullrequest.title: Communication model based on graph cost

content.raw: Is it possible to calculate the bounds from the world file instead of manually specify the bounds here? For example, you could iterate over all the models in the world to find the extents.
content.html: Is it possible to calculate the bounds from the world file instead of manually specify the bounds here? For example, you could iterate over all the models in the world to find the extents.

pullrequest.title: Communication model based on graph cost

content.raw: We could if we assume that the only models in the world are the tiles. These constants are also used in the visualization function \(_CommsModel::VisualizeVisibility\(\)_\). I think we might need to add the limits found while building the LUT into the .dat file.
content.html: We could if we assume that the only models in the world are the tiles. These constants are also used in the visualization function (CommsModel::VisualizeVisibility()). I think we might need to add the limits found while building the LUT into the .dat file.

pullrequest.title: Communication model based on graph cost

content.raw: Is the purpose of the  `.dat` file only to figure out which SUBT tile the robot is currently occupying \(thus, getting the vertex ID for the graph in the `.dot`file\)? If so, aren’t we already effectively computing this as part of Gazebo’s AABB collision check routine?
content.html: Is the purpose of the .dat file only to figure out which SUBT tile the robot is currently occupying (thus, getting the vertex ID for the graph in the .dotfile)? If so, aren’t we already effectively computing this as part of Gazebo’s AABB collision check routine?

pullrequest.title: Communication model based on graph cost

content.raw:
Exactly, the purpose is to get the vertex ID for the graph.

We could get the vertex Id at runtime but we would need to check AABB collisions between the current model’s bounding box and the rest of the tiles. This might be computational expensive, as this is something to do every iteration.
content.html:
Exactly, the purpose is to get the vertex ID for the graph.

We could get the vertex Id at runtime but we would need to check AABB collisions between the current model’s bounding box and the rest of the tiles. This might be computational expensive, as this is something to do every iteration.
